Department Overview

The aim of the Risk Analytics team is to enhance the risk practices of PG&E’s Electric Operation business and thereby address changing external conditions such as climate change. To this end the Risk Analytics team creates and maintains tools to enable PG&E to close the gap between metrics and electric system performance. These tools provide a multi-layered view of risk across the electric system so that decision-making processes include and empower employees at all levels of the company to manage risk appropriately.

Imagine if every time you went to the doctor you paid cash upfront before you are treated
column2: where every time you rented an apartment you paid 2 years cash upfront
column3: or where your monthly paycheck is frequently delayed for months at a time. Then imagine doing that without a loan
column5: or even bank accounts. This is everyday life for over 3 billion people in developing countries around the world. We are Migo
column6: and we are on a mission to change this by re-inventing the way people access and use credit.

column1: Through a simple API integration to our platform
column2: companies can enable their customers to make purchases and pay bills on credit
column3: or get personal loans. Leveraging proprietary datasets
column4: Migo builds ML algorithms on customer phone records
column6: and payment transactions to assess credit risk
column7: enabling us to offer credit lines to individuals and small businesses. This credit line can be used to make purchases from a merchant or withdraw cash without the need for point-of-sale hardware or plastic cards. Because of our proprietary data and innovative technical solutions
column8: Migo is able to provide credit to underbanked customers who are not typically covered by credit bureaus
column9: a critical area of growth for developing countries.

column1: WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR

Are you a Data Scientist ready to help us redefine credit for the 21st century? We are on a mission to leverage data from partners around the globe to perform credit scoring for 3 billion people. The opportunities for you to make an impact are limitless. We are looking for candidates who have expertise in:

Understanding and clearly articulate trade-offs of various approaches to solving data science problems Working and experimenting with large data-sets Feature engineering for machine learning Iterating on and experimenting with models Documenting your work clearly for others to follow. Bayesian statistical modeling  Deep learning  Quickly learning new tools.
You should be a clear and concise communicator
column2: with an ability to communicate ideas to a wide range of stakeholders both technical and non-technical. You appreciate hearing different points of view and wait to hear other’s point of view before offering your own. You have a pragmatic approach to building systems
column3: see multiple ways of solving problems
column4: and are able to discuss the tradeoffs of each solution. You are technology agnostic with broad depth and breadth of experience using many different technologies.

column1: Ideally you have traveled extensively or have lived in a developing country. You are empathetic
column2: self-aware and respect all cultures. You are fun and enlightening to work with
column3: and you have a good work / life balance with hobbies and interests you are happy to share with others. And you want to work in San Francisco.

column1: HOW WE INTERVIEW AND HIRE
Our interview process begins with an introductory call to help you better understand the opportunity
column2: give us a glimpse into your interests and motivations
column3: and help you decide if Migo is the right place for you to be your happiest and most successful self. From there
column4: we will conduct a technical screen with one of our data scientists so you can show us your skills. If all goes well
column5: you will be invited onsite to interview with an interview panel from our data science and software engineering teams. Our onsite interview includes 3-4 technical rounds
column6: as well as conversations around what it is like to work at Migo and how you would work with the team on a daily basis. It is designed to assess a broad range of skills so that we can gain a holistic understanding of what you bring to the team and where you shine. We pride ourselves on being transparent throughout the entire interview process with conversations around compensation and the impact you will make here at Migo.

column1: WHY SHOULD YOU WORK AT MIGO?
When you come to work at Migo
column2: you can be assured that your work will be deeply meaningful. You will spend your days solving challenging problems alongside smart and capable colleagues. Daily decisions here have tangible and immediate impact on millions of people. You will be given both the respect and the latitude to drive best-practices for building world-class systems. You will be fully supported by executive management
column3: many of whom have engineering backgrounds and will share your concerns if you say we are accumulating too much technical debt.

column1: One day you will look back and realize that you did some of the best work of your career here. You will have significantly increased your positive impact on the world during your career here. Migo is growing quickly and operating in a trillion-dollar market with few competitors. Your equity has a high chance of producing significant upside.

Minimum of a BS degree in a relevant field required or equivalent experience 2+ years of work experience using machine learning for supervised and unsupervised learning Demonstrable history of writing clean

column3: multi-faceted projects as part of a team

Department Overview

The aim of the Risk Analytics team is to enhance the risk practices of PG&E’s Electric Operation business and thereby address changing external conditions such as climate change. To this end the Risk Analytics team creates and maintains tools to enable PG&E to close the gap between metrics and electric system performance. These tools provide a multi-layered view of risk across the electric system so that decision-making processes include and empower employees at all levels of the company to manage risk appropriately.
In creating these tools

column1: Migo|"WHAT WE DO
Imagine if every time you went to the doctor you paid cash upfront before you are treated
column2: where every time you rented an apartment you paid 2 years cash upfront
column3: or where your monthly paycheck is frequently delayed for months at a time. Then imagine doing that without a loan
column5: or even bank accounts. This is everyday life for over 3 billion people in developing countries around the world. We are Migo
column6: and we are on a mission to change this by re-inventing the way people access and use credit.

column1: Through a simple API integration to our platform
column2: companies can enable their customers to make purchases and pay bills on credit
column3: or get personal loans. Leveraging proprietary datasets
column4: Migo builds ML algorithms on customer phone records
column6: and payment transactions to assess credit risk
column7: enabling us to offer credit lines to individuals and small businesses. This credit line can be used to make purchases from a merchant or withdraw cash without the need for point-of-sale hardware or plastic cards. Because of our proprietary data and innovative technical solutions
column8: Migo is able to provide credit to underbanked customers who are not typically covered by credit bureaus
column9: a critical area of growth for developing countries.

column1: WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR

Are you a Data Scientist ready to help us redefine credit for the 21st century? We are on a mission to leverage data from partners around the globe to perform credit scoring for 3 billion people. The opportunities for you to make an impact are limitless. We are looking for candidates who have expertise in:

Understanding and clearly articulate trade-offs of various approaches to solving data science problems Working and experimenting with large data-sets Feature engineering for machine learning Iterating on and experimenting with models Documenting your work clearly for others to follow. Bayesian statistical modeling Deep learning Quickly learning new tools.
You should be a clear and concise communicator
column2: with an ability to communicate ideas to a wide range of stakeholders both technical and non-technical. You appreciate hearing different points of view and wait to hear other’s point of view before offering your own. You have a pragmatic approach to building systems
column3: see multiple ways of solving problems
column4: and are able to discuss the tradeoffs of each solution. You are technology agnostic with broad depth and breadth of experience using many different technologies.

column1: Ideally you have traveled extensively or have lived in a developing country. You are empathetic
column2: self-aware and respect all cultures. You are fun and enlightening to work with
column3: and you have a good work / life balance with hobbies and interests you are happy to share with others. And you want to work in San Francisco.

column1: HOW WE INTERVIEW AND HIRE
Our interview process begins with an introductory call to help you better understand the opportunity
column2: give us a glimpse into your interests and motivations
column3: and help you decide if Migo is the right place for you to be your happiest and most successful self. From there
column4: we will conduct a technical screen with one of our data scientists so you can show us your skills. If all goes well
column5: you will be invited onsite to interview with an interview panel from our data science and software engineering teams. Our onsite interview includes 3-4 technical rounds
column6: as well as conversations around what it is like to work at Migo and how you would work with the team on a daily basis. It is designed to assess a broad range of skills so that we can gain a holistic understanding of what you bring to the team and where you shine. We pride ourselves on being transparent throughout the entire interview process with conversations around compensation and the impact you will make here at Migo.

column1: WHY SHOULD YOU WORK AT MIGO?
When you come to work at Migo
column2: you can be assured that your work will be deeply meaningful. You will spend your days solving challenging problems alongside smart and capable colleagues. Daily decisions here have tangible and immediate impact on millions of people. You will be given both the respect and the latitude to drive best-practices for building world-class systems. You will be fully supported by executive management
column3: many of whom have engineering backgrounds and will share your concerns if you say we are accumulating too much technical debt.

column1: One day you will look back and realize that you did some of the best work of your career here. You will have significantly increased your positive impact on the world during your career here. Migo is growing quickly and operating in a trillion-dollar market with few competitors. Your equity has a high chance of producing significant upside.

Department Overview

The aim of the Risk Analytics team is to enhance the risk practices of PG&E’s Electric Operation business and thereby address changing external conditions such as climate change. To this end the Risk Analytics team creates and maintains tools to enable PG&E to close the gap between metrics and electric system performance. These tools provide a multi-layered view of risk across the electric system so that decision-making processes include and empower employees at all levels of the company to manage risk appropriately.

column1: Migo|"WHAT WE DO
Imagine if every time you went to the doctor you paid cash upfront before you are treated
column2: where every time you rented an apartment you paid 2 years cash upfront
column3: or where your monthly paycheck is frequently delayed for months at a time. Then imagine doing that without a loan
column5: or even bank accounts. This is everyday life for over 3 billion people in developing countries around the world. We are Migo
column6: and we are on a mission to change this by re-inventing the way people access and use credit.

column1: Through a simple API integration to our platform
column2: companies can enable their customers to make purchases and pay bills on credit
column3: or get personal loans. Leveraging proprietary datasets
column4: Migo builds ML algorithms on customer phone records
column6: and payment transactions to assess credit risk
column7: enabling us to offer credit lines to individuals and small businesses. This credit line can be used to make purchases from a merchant or withdraw cash without the need for point-of-sale hardware or plastic cards. Because of our proprietary data and innovative technical solutions
column8: Migo is able to provide credit to underbanked customers who are not typically covered by credit bureaus
column9: a critical area of growth for developing countries.

column1: WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR

Are you a Data Scientist ready to help us redefine credit for the 21st century? We are on a mission to leverage data from partners around the globe to perform credit scoring for 3 billion people. The opportunities for you to make an impact are limitless. We are looking for candidates who have expertise in:

Understanding and clearly articulate trade-offs of various approaches to solving data science problems Working and experimenting with large data-sets Feature engineering for machine learning Iterating on and experimenting with models Documenting your work clearly for others to follow. Bayesian statistical modeling  Deep learning  Quickly learning new tools.
You should be a clear and concise communicator
column2: with an ability to communicate ideas to a wide range of stakeholders both technical and non-technical. You appreciate hearing different points of view and wait to hear other’s point of view before offering your own. You have a pragmatic approach to building systems
column3: see multiple ways of solving problems
column4: and are able to discuss the tradeoffs of each solution. You are technology agnostic with broad depth and breadth of experience using many different technologies.

column1: Ideally you have traveled extensively or have lived in a developing country. You are empathetic
column2: self-aware and respect all cultures. You are fun and enlightening to work with
column3: and you have a good work / life balance with hobbies and interests you are happy to share with others. And you want to work in San Francisco.

column1: HOW WE INTERVIEW AND HIRE
Our interview process begins with an introductory call to help you better understand the opportunity
column2: give us a glimpse into your interests and motivations
column3: and help you decide if Migo is the right place for you to be your happiest and most successful self. From there
column4: we will conduct a technical screen with one of our data scientists so you can show us your skills. If all goes well
column5: you will be invited onsite to interview with an interview panel from our data science and software engineering teams. Our onsite interview includes 3-4 technical rounds
column6: as well as conversations around what it is like to work at Migo and how you would work with the team on a daily basis. It is designed to assess a broad range of skills so that we can gain a holistic understanding of what you bring to the team and where you shine. We pride ourselves on being transparent throughout the entire interview process with conversations around compensation and the impact you will make here at Migo.

column1: WHY SHOULD YOU WORK AT MIGO?
When you come to work at Migo
column2: you can be assured that your work will be deeply meaningful. You will spend your days solving challenging problems alongside smart and capable colleagues. Daily decisions here have tangible and immediate impact on millions of people. You will be given both the respect and the latitude to drive best-practices for building world-class systems. You will be fully supported by executive management
column3: many of whom have engineering backgrounds and will share your concerns if you say we are accumulating too much technical debt.

column1: One day you will look back and realize that you did some of the best work of your career here. You will have significantly increased your positive impact on the world during your career here. Migo is growing quickly and operating in a trillion-dollar market with few competitors. Your equity has a high chance of producing significant upside.

Department Overview

The aim of the Risk Analytics team is to enhance the risk practices of PG&E’s Electric Operation business and thereby address changing external conditions such as climate change. To this end the Risk Analytics team creates and maintains tools to enable PG&E to close the gap between metrics and electric system performance. These tools provide a multi-layered view of risk across the electric system so that decision-making processes include and empower employees at all levels of the company to manage risk appropriately.

Farmer's Business Network
What do you get when you cross the best of Silicon Valley innovation with farming and rural values? Farmer's Business Network
We are proudly Farmers First℠. FBN is an independent and unbiased network of thousands of American farms. By enabling thousands of farmers to work together
column2: anonymously and securely to democratize information
column3: the FBN network is helping our members level the playing field and putting power back into farmers' hands.

column1: THE ROLE
How can we sustainably feed the world? With the population set to reach nine billion by 2050 and available farmland decreasing
column2: the odds are stacked against us. This problem falls squarely on the shoulders of farmers
column3: who are increasingly working harder for less. FBN helps farmers to solve these problems.

column1: Farmers are often forced to make key decisions in the face of significant uncertainty about their impact. FBN applies technology and data science to this challenge. We're building the world's largest agronomic dataset - made up of billions of data points
column2: gathered from sophisticated sensors on farm equipment. The network effect of farmers sharing their data allows us to deliver unprecedented analyses that help farmers make data-driven decisions - we're not just building new technology
column3: we're also making new agricultural scientific discoveries.

column1: We're looking for data scientists who are enthusiastic about applying big data to help farmers!
Data science underlies every product that we build at FBN
column2: so you'll see your work directly translate into new products for our farmers. The data science team at FBN:

column1: Explores one of the world's most unique
Furthers scientific understanding about what affects agricultural production.
Uncovers insights that help farmers efficiently support a growing population.
Makes meaningful improvements in the world by translating data science into products that help farmers increase yield and efficiency.

Deep understanding of statistical modeling concepts.
Familiarity with machine learning algorithms.
Excellent programming skills (R or Python preferred).
Preferred: understanding of agricultural systems (soil chemistry
Required Experience
MS or greater in statistics or related discipline

column1: Migo|"WHAT WE DO
Imagine if every time you went to the doctor you paid cash upfront before you are treated
column2: where every time you rented an apartment you paid 2 years cash upfront
column3: or where your monthly paycheck is frequently delayed for months at a time. Then imagine doing that without a loan
column5: or even bank accounts. This is everyday life for over 3 billion people in developing countries around the world. We are Migo
column6: and we are on a mission to change this by re-inventing the way people access and use credit.

column1: Through a simple API integration to our platform
column2: companies can enable their customers to make purchases and pay bills on credit
column3: or get personal loans. Leveraging proprietary datasets
column4: Migo builds ML algorithms on customer phone records
column6: and payment transactions to assess credit risk
column7: enabling us to offer credit lines to individuals and small businesses. This credit line can be used to make purchases from a merchant or withdraw cash without the need for point-of-sale hardware or plastic cards. Because of our proprietary data and innovative technical solutions
column8: Migo is able to provide credit to underbanked customers who are not typically covered by credit bureaus
column9: a critical area of growth for developing countries.

column1: WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR

Are you a Data Scientist ready to help us redefine credit for the 21st century? We are on a mission to leverage data from partners around the globe to perform credit scoring for 3 billion people. The opportunities for you to make an impact are limitless. We are looking for candidates who have expertise in:

Understanding and clearly articulate trade-offs of various approaches to solving data science problems Working and experimenting with large data-sets Feature engineering for machine learning Iterating on and experimenting with models Documenting your work clearly for others to follow. Bayesian statistical modeling Deep learning Quickly learning new tools.
You should be a clear and concise communicator
column2: with an ability to communicate ideas to a wide range of stakeholders both technical and non-technical. You appreciate hearing different points of view and wait to hear other’s point of view before offering your own. You have a pragmatic approach to building systems
column3: see multiple ways of solving problems
column4: and are able to discuss the tradeoffs of each solution. You are technology agnostic with broad depth and breadth of experience using many different technologies.

column1: Ideally you have traveled extensively or have lived in a developing country. You are empathetic
column2: self-aware and respect all cultures. You are fun and enlightening to work with
column3: and you have a good work / life balance with hobbies and interests you are happy to share with others. And you want to work in San Francisco.

column1: HOW WE INTERVIEW AND HIRE
Our interview process begins with an introductory call to help you better understand the opportunity
column2: give us a glimpse into your interests and motivations
column3: and help you decide if Migo is the right place for you to be your happiest and most successful self. From there
column4: we will conduct a technical screen with one of our data scientists so you can show us your skills. If all goes well
column5: you will be invited onsite to interview with an interview panel from our data science and software engineering teams. Our onsite interview includes 3-4 technical rounds
column6: as well as conversations around what it is like to work at Migo and how you would work with the team on a daily basis. It is designed to assess a broad range of skills so that we can gain a holistic understanding of what you bring to the team and where you shine. We pride ourselves on being transparent throughout the entire interview process with conversations around compensation and the impact you will make here at Migo.

column1: WHY SHOULD YOU WORK AT MIGO?
When you come to work at Migo
column2: you can be assured that your work will be deeply meaningful. You will spend your days solving challenging problems alongside smart and capable colleagues. Daily decisions here have tangible and immediate impact on millions of people. You will be given both the respect and the latitude to drive best-practices for building world-class systems. You will be fully supported by executive management
column3: many of whom have engineering backgrounds and will share your concerns if you say we are accumulating too much technical debt.

column1: One day you will look back and realize that you did some of the best work of your career here. You will have significantly increased your positive impact on the world during your career here. Migo is growing quickly and operating in a trillion-dollar market with few competitors. Your equity has a high chance of producing significant upside.

Job Category : Accounting / Finance
Job Level : Individual Contributor
Business Unit: Electric Operations
Job Location : San Francisco
Department Overview

The aim of the Risk Analytics team is to enhance the risk practices of PG&E’s Electric Operation business and thereby address changing external conditions such as climate change. To this end the Risk Analytics team creates and maintains tools to enable PG&E to close the gap between metrics and electric system performance. These tools provide a multi-layered view of risk across the electric system so that decision-making processes include and empower employees at all levels of the company to manage risk appropriately.
In creating these tools

column3: lean solution process to expand PG&E’s ability to assess and manage risk. The result are assessments and mitigations that are more dynamic
column6: with a multi-layered approach for both short-term and long-term time horizons.
